Passage: Morse code is a character encoding scheme used in telecommunication that encodes text characters as standardized sequences of two different signal durations called dots and dashes  or dits and dahs.[2][3] Morse code is named for Samuel F. B. Morse, an inventor of the telegraph. Question: Who invented Morse Code? Answer:

summary: Morse code is a character encoding scheme used in telecommunication that encodes text characters as standardized sequences of two different signal durations called dots and dashes  or dits and dahs.[2][3] Morse code is named for Samuel F. B. Morse, an inventor of the telegraph.
question: Who invented Morse Code?
label: Samuel F. B. Morse
